description: builder: label the race builder as "race"

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

third row?

[           linux           ]
[ 386 x64 x64   arm  arm    ]
[         race panda cheney ]

?

On Wed, Oct 10, 2012 at 4:25 PM, <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> I'd prefer a more generic solution that shows the suffixes of all the
> builders
>
> https://codereview.appspot.**com/6648043/<https://codereview.appspot.com/6648043/>
>
I'd prefer a more generic solution that shows the suffixes of all the builders

That would be awesome if you could make it happen. I've wanted that for a while.

On Thu, Oct 11, 2012 at 10:28 AM, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
> third row?
>
> [           linux           ]
> [ 386 x64 x64   arm  arm    ]
> [         race panda cheney ]
>
> ?
>
> On Wed, Oct 10, 2012 at 4:25 PM, <adg@golang.org> wrote:
>>
>> I'd prefer a more generic solution that shows the suffixes of all the
>> builders
>>
>> https://codereview.appspot.com/6648043/
>
>

On 11 October 2012 10:28, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
> third row?
>
> [           linux           ]
> [ 386 x64 x64   arm  arm    ]
> [         race panda cheney ]

SGTM

I would prefer not to show the suffixes. Sometimes they are
informational but sometimes they are just for disambiguation, to
create a unique name as we move from one builder to another. For
example the windows 386 builder's long name is windows-386-ec2.

You can already hover over the column to find out the suffix if you really care.

I do agree with special-casing the race builder. This CL looks fine.

Russ

the description: s|builder:|dashboard:|

misc/dashboard or misc/dashboard/app is also used in the past.

but note that builder is specifically for misc/dashboard/builder.

On Friday, October 12, 2012 7:02:04 PM UTC+4, rsc wrote:

> I would prefer not to show the suffixes. Sometimes they are 
> informational but sometimes they are just for disambiguation, to 
> create a unique name as we move from one builder to another. For 
> example the windows 386 builder's long name is windows-386-ec2. 
>
> You can already hover over the column to find out the suffix if you really 
> care. 
>

I don't know how to hover on my android phone. And I think there are people 
who have issues with hover in general.
 

>
> I do agree with special-casing the race builder. This CL looks fine. 
>
>

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=ff0701405048 ***

builder: label the race builder as "race"

R=golang-dev, adg, dave, rsc, minux.ma, dvyukov
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6648043

> I don't know how to hover on my android phone. And I think there are people
> who have issues with hover in general.

I understand that. Generally useful information should be there by
default, which is why I support the explicit "race" label here. But I
don't think complete information needs to be. The dashboard is very
dense in part because of all the stuff that's hidden behind hovers.
For example you can hover over any of the CLs first-lines to get the
full description.

Russ

subject: code review 6648043: builder: label the race builder as "race"
